text: {"grade": 0, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to note that profits of a Brazilian company distributed to a foreign shareholder are exempt from Brazilian withholding income tax (WHT). The candidate answer states: \"Brazil: historically no WHT on dividends (but closely monitor legislative changes and timing; Brazil has repeatedly considered dividend taxation reforms). If dividends remain WHT-free, Brazil becomes a natural cash generator to the group...\". This acknowledges the historical exemption but does not definitively state it as a current, established fact for the purpose of planning, instead framing it as conditional on monitoring future changes.
